Annotation Interface HostCompilerDirectives.BytecodeInterpreterHandlerConfig

Enclosing class:
HostCompilerDirectives
@Retention(RUNTIME) @Target(METHOD) public static @interface HostCompilerDirectives.BytecodeInterpreterHandlerConfig
Configuration for all bytecode interpreter handler arguments, including the receiver. Must be used in conjunction with HostCompilerDirectives.BytecodeInterpreterSwitch.
Since:
25.1
See Also:
  • HostCompilerDirectives.BytecodeInterpreterHandler

    HostCompilerDirectives.BytecodeInterpreterHandlerConfig.Argument
    Configuration for a bytecode interpreter handler argument.

  • Required Element Summary

    Required Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Required Element
    Description
    HostCompilerDirectives.BytecodeInterpreterHandlerConfig.Argument[]
    arguments
    Configuration for each method argument.
    int
    maximumOperationCode
    The maximum unsigned value of the opcode.

  • Element Details

    • maximumOperationCode

      int maximumOperationCode
      The maximum unsigned value of the opcode. This is relevant for HostCompilerDirectives.BytecodeInterpreterHandler when tail call threading is enabled, and is used to construct a handler table.

    • arguments

      HostCompilerDirectives.BytecodeInterpreterHandlerConfig.Argument[] arguments
      Configuration for each method argument. For non-static methods, the first element corresponds to the receiver.
